page.title: 09MACHINES IN THE HOMES
page.content: COMMON LABOUR-SAVING DEVICES IN THE HOMES OF THE 1980'S INCLUDE:- {WASHING MACHINE:}AN ELECTRICALLY OPERATED MACHINE FOR CLEANING CLOTHES AND BEDDING.{FRIDGE:}ITS PURPOSE IS TO KEEP FOOD FRESH. IT IS VERY COMMON AND ALMOST EVERYBODY HAS ONE IN THE KITCHEN.{TEASMADE:}IT IS A MACHINE THAT WAKES YOU UP IN THE MORNING AND MAKES YOUR TEA. IT IS USUALLY KEPT IN THE BEDROOM.{DISHWASHER:}ITS PURPOSE IS TO WASH AND DRY OUR FOOD DISHES WHILE WE DO SOMETHING ELSE. {HOME COMPUTER:}THESE CAN COME IN MANY SHAPES AND COLOURS. THE CASING IS MADE OF PLASTIC.INSIDE THEY HAVE MICROCHIPS AND A MEMORY (WHICH STORES INFORMATION).IT CAN BE USED FOR MANY THINGS EG: GAMES,PROGRAMING, ACCOUNTS, ETC.{MICROWAVE OVEN:}THESE COOK FOOD EXTREMELY QUICKLY.{ELECTRIC {BLANKET:}THIS MAKES BEDS NICE AND WARM
